Assuming that the game is played in a single round and both players are rational, the Responder would typically accept any offer that gives them a positive payoff, since receiving some amount of money is better than receiving nothing at all.

However, since the Proposer has all the bargaining power in this game, they could offer the Responder a very small amount (say, $1) and keep the rest for themselves.
